parity_gates.name: Artifact format compliance
parity_gates.evidence: legacy_anchor_map.v1.json, contract_table.v1.json, security_threat_matrix.md â€” all schema-validated

parity_gates.name: Unit tests
parity_gates.evidence: 37 unit tests in fj-backend-cpu + 14 in fj-runtime covering Backend trait, CpuBackend, Buffer, Device, Registry

parity_gates.name: Oracle/differential conformance
parity_gates.evidence: 5 oracle tests: CPU backend matches eval_jaxpr for all program specs, discovery, dtype support

parity_gates.name: Adversarial validation
parity_gates.evidence: 6 adversarial tests: unsupported backend, nonexistent device alloc/transfer, zero-size buffer, empty registry, fallback

parity_gates.name: Metamorphic properties
parity_gates.evidence: 4 metamorphic tests: device-count independence, transfer identity, transfer chain, capability reflection

parity_gates.name: Performance targets
parity_gates.evidence: All 6 benchmarks sub-200ns. execute/add2=145ns, execute/square=136ns, allocate=28ns, transfer=26ns, discovery=16ns

parity_gates.name: E2E scenarios
parity_gates.evidence: 6 E2E scenarios: all primitives, discovery, device routing, fallback, cross-backend consistency, buffer round-trip

parity_gates.name: Risk analysis
parity_gates.evidence: 5-threat risk note with mitigation evidence. 8 invariants verified.

known_issues: BackendCapabilities only lists F64 and I64 (F32/I32 not yet supported in fj-core)
Backend.execute() ignores device ID on CPU (all execution is host-resident)
